result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J. Wagner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:35 am case called. Defendant Tyler J. Wagner in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi, by phone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding personal appearance of Attorney Chirafisi-Defendant waives personal appearance of Attorney Chirafisi and court accepts waiver. Guilty plea previously entered. Court accepts plea of Guilty and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 8 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 2 days served. To begin forthwith.  Court directs a 4 hour furlough to be extended to the defendant to obtain IID to be done within the first two weeks of the jail sentence. Court does not object to jail transfer. $1744.00 fine inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond to be applied. 36 mo DL revocation, 36 mo IID effective today, OWI assessment, AODA and follow through.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

9:13 am cases called. 15CF71, 15CF204, & 15TR1097. Defendant Tyler J. Wagner in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Court regarding conference with counsel prior to matter being called. Counsel concurs with courts statement. Court receives recommendation regarding resolution. Agreement stated on record.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Guilty to Count 1 of 15CF71.  Court accepts plea and adjourns sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 11:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Corey Chirafisi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Chriafisi states the defendant is going to enter a plea. Court sets matter for plea/sentencing and removes trial from calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

15CF71 & 15CF204 3:49 pm cases called. Defendant Tyler J. Wagner in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF204- Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Discussion regarding 15CF71 & jury trial settled.  Status conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
